page.title: 18ESGYRN DEER FARM
page.content: Esgyrn farm is situated in an area which has changed very little over the years.This farm is not what one would expect to find in such an area. From a run down mixed farm it has been converted into a successful deer farm.The farm,which is 200 acres and it is stocked by 260 head of deer.Of these 140 are at present breeding hinds. The family run farm was developed at Esgyrn in 1981 after a similar venture at Ramsey Island.They began by killing deer themselves and serving local high class restaurants to order.Today all the stock is exported abroad to an ever expanding market.Over 50 farmers have set up the British Deer Producers Association to assist in such export ventures.It is clear that this is a viable farming concern with healthy return and interest being shown by the Ministry.
